data.title: Memorial Day 2023: Where are the parades and ceremonies happening in N.J.?
data.meta_description: Here's a county by county list of Memorial Day events taking place in 2023.
data.text:
Here’s a sample of some of the Memorial Day commemorations taking place throughout the Garden State.

Atlantic County

ATLANTIC COUNTY

Memorial Day Service, 2 p.m. May 26, Atlantic County Veterans Cemetery, 109 Boulevard Rt. 50, atlantic-county.org, 609- 343-2313.

ATLANTIC CITY

Memorial Day Service, 12 p.m. May 29, Brown’s Memorial Park, 135 N. Dr Martin Luther King, Jr. Blvd. acnj.gov, 609-347-5300.

EGG HARBOR CITY

Memorial Day Service, 11 a.m. May 29, Lincoln Park (Rt. 30 and Buffalo Ave.) eggharborcity.org, 609-965-0081.

EGG HARBOR TWP.

Memorial Day Parade, march from North Mount Airy/Zion Road to Ocean Heights Avenue, ending at Veterans Memorial Park, Ocean Heights Avenue and Swift Drive, 9 a.m. May 29. rfedeli@ehtgov.org, 609-926-4088.

FOLSOM

Memorial Day Service, 10 a.m. May 28, Folsom Borough Hall, 1700 12th St. pgatto@folsomborough.com, 609-561-3178.

HAMMONTON

Memorial Day Parade and Service, march from Egg Harbor Rd. and Bellevue Ave., for ceremony at Veterans Memorial Park, 10:30 a.m. May 29. townofhammonton.org, 609-567-4300.

NORTHFIELD

Memorial Day Service, 9:30 a.m. May 29, Veterans Park, 1913 Oak Ave. cityofnorthfield.org, 609-641-2832.

SOMERS POINT

Memorial Day Parade, march from Dawes Avenue and Shore Road to Somers Point City Hall, 1 W. New Jersey Ave., for ceremony at Patriots Park at Bethel Road and First Street, 10 a.m. May 29. somerspointgov.org, 609-927-9088.

VENTNOR CITY

Memorial Day Services, 9:30 a.m. May 29 Ventnor City Hall, 6201 Atlantic Ave., and 11 a.m. at VFW Post 3361 on Dorset Ave. ventnorcity.org, 609-823-7900.

WEYMOUTH TWP.

Memorial Day Services, 9:00 a.m. May 29 Weymouth Twp. Municipal Hall, 45 South Jersey Ave., 9:45 a.m. Estell Manor School, Cape May Ave., and 10:30 a.m. Belcoville Memorial, Madden Ave. weymouthnj.org, 609-476-2633.

Bergen County

ALLENDALE

Memorial Day Parade and Service, march from Myrtle Ave. & Pittis Ave. through Downtown to De Mercurio Dr. and W. Orchard St., toward Park Ave., to Memorial Park, Brookside Ave. and Park Ave, for a ceremony, 9:30 a.m. May 29. allendalenj.gov, 201-818-4400.

CLIFFSIDE PARK

Memorial Day Service, observance in coordination with American Legion Post 126, 11 a.m. May 29, Memorial Park, Gorge and Palisade avenues. cliffsideparknj.gov, 201-945-3456

CLOSTER

Memorial Day Parade, march from Vervalen Street in front of the Closter Plaza, continue through center of town to Memorial Park on Harrington Ave., for a ceremony, 10 a.m. May 29. closterboro.com, 201-784-0600.

DUMONT

Memorial Day Parade and Services, prayer service 7:45 a.m. at Woodside Cemetery, Prospect and McKinley avenues, followed by march from Pershing Street and Virginia Avenue down Madison Avenue to Prospect and New Milford avenues toward Virginia Avenue, concluding at Memorial Park, Pershing Street, for a ceremony, May 29. dumontnj.gov, 201-384-1453.

EDGEWATER

Memorial Day Parade and Service, march from American Legion Post 116 to Memorial Park, Route 5 and River Road, for solemn memorial service, 11 a.m. May 29. edgewaternj.org, 201-943-1700.

FORT LEE

Memorial Day Parade, march from Jack Alter Community Center, 1355 Inwood Terrace, north on Center Avenue, west on Main Street and South on Anderson Avenue, back to center for ceremony and refreshments, 10 a.m. May 29. fortleecommunitycenter.org, 201-592-4699.

GARFIELD

Memorial Day Ceremony, hosted by Garfield VFW Post 2867, 340 Outwater Lane, 11 a.m. May 29. 973-772-4696.

HASBROUCK HEIGHTS

Memorial Day Service, Veterans Park, Terrance Ave., 11 a.m. May 29. hasbrouck-heightsnj.org, 201-288-0195.

HAWORTH

Memorial Day Parade and Service, march from Fire House at 71 Hardenburgh Ave. to Borough Hall at 320 Blvd. for a service with complimentary hot dogs, 8:30 a.m. May 29. haworthnj.org, 201-384-4785.

HO-HO-KUS

Memorial Day Parade and Ceremony, march from Sheridan and Ardmore avenues to War Memorial on East Franklin Turnpike for service hosted by the VFW, 10:30 a.m. May 29, Washington Elm VFW Post 192, 620 Cliff St. hhkborough.com, 201-652-4400.

LODI

Memorial Day Observance, 8:30 a.m. Ambulance Corps ceremony at 72 Kimmig Ave., 9:15 a.m. fire department ceremony at 99 Kennedy Drive, 10:15 a.m. VFW ceremony at 163 Union St., 11 a.m. American Legion ceremony at 41 Union St., and 11:45 a.m. police department ceremony at 1 Memorial Drive, followed by “Walkway for Peace” ceremony, May 29. lodiboro.org, 973-365-4005.

LYNDHURST

Memorial Day Parade, ceremony at Lyndhurst Town Hall Park, Delafield and Court avenues, followed by march north on Delafield Avenue, making right turns on Second Avenue, Ridge Road and Valley Brook Avenue to return to park, 10:00 a.m. May 29. lyndhurstnj.org, 201-804-2457.

MAHWAH

Memorial Day Parade and Service, Immaculate Heart of Mary Church on Island Road, followed by the ceremony held at Veterans Memorial Park, at the corner of Franklin Tpk. and East Ramapo Ave. 10 a.m. May 29, mahwahtwp.org, 201-529-5757.

MIDLAND PARK

Memorial Day Observance, flag raising 9 a.m. Saturday, May 27, at Veterans Monument on Dairy Street, followed by 10 a.m. parade from municipal parking lot on Highland Ave. to Vreeland Avenue then onto Franklin Avenue, proceeding along Godwin Avenue to Central Ave, to Veterans Plaza, Wortendyke, for a service, concluding with refreshments at Fire Station Social Hall, 45 Witte Drive, May 27. midlandparknj.org, 201-445-5720.

MOONACHIE

Memorial Day Observance, service at borough hall, 125 Moonachie Road, 10:30 a.m. May 27. moonachie.us, 201-641-1813.

NORTH ARLINGTON

Memorial Day Parade, 12:30 p.m. march on Ridge Road from Canterbury Avenue south to Borough Hall, 214 Ridge Road, for music, food truck and ice cream. 2 p.m. May 29. northarlington.org, (201) 991-6060.

OAKLAND

Memorial Day Observance, hosted by American Legion Oakland Memorial Post 369 with brief ceremonies at Pond’s Church Cemetery in Oakland and Mary Rest Cemetery in Mahwah, followed by 1 p.m. parade to Veterans Park, complimentary food and refreshments at American Legion Post, 65 Oak Street, immediately after, Sunday, May 28. oakland-nj.org, 201-337-9845.

OLD TAPPAN

Memorial Day Parade, march from Northern Valley Old Tappan High School to Oakes Park on Central Avenue for a ceremony with parading of the colors, national anthem, invocation, wreath laying, rifle salute, taps and address by the mayor, 9:30 a.m. May 29, Oakes Park, Central Avenue and Haring Drive. oldtappen.net, 201-768-1941.

ORADELL

Memorial Day Observance, wreath laying ceremonies at WWI Memorial near the post office, Hoffman/Rossi near Waite Place and the Fire Department and WWII memorial at Prospect and Park avenues, followed by ceremony at Memorial Park, 8:30 a.m. May 29, oradell.org, 201-261-8200.

TENAFLY

Memorial Day Parade, march from George Street to Huyler Park, County Road, for ceremony, refreshments and hotdogs courtesy of Tenafly Elks Lodge 2271 at 20 Franklin St., 10 a.m. May 29. tenaflynj.org, 201-568-5567.

WASHINGTON TWP.

Memorial Day Parade, march from Washington and Clinton avenues down Pascack Road to Memorial Monument in front of town hall for service, 10 a.m. May 29, Washington Township Municipal Building, 350 Hudson Ave. twpofwashington.us, 201-664-4404.

WESTWOOD

Memorial Day Service and Parade, 8:00 a.m. service hosted by the Fire Department at Firemen’s Park, located next to Park Ave. and Memorial Drive, followed by march down Westwood Ave. From Five Corners, concluding at Veterans Park for service, 9 a.m. May 29, westwoodnj.gov, 201-664-7100.

WOOD-RIDGE

Memorial Day Service, ceremony at Walk of Freedom, located at the corner of Hackensack Street and Highland Avenue, 6:30 p.m., Thursday, May 25, njwoodridge.org, 201-939-0202.

WYCKOFF

Memorial Day Observance, 8:45 a.m. firefighters memorial service at Firehouse No. 1 behind town hall followed by 10 a.m. veterans memorial service at Wyckoff Reformed Church on Wyckoff Avenue, capped off with 11:30 a.m. parade along Wyckoff Avenue, right on Main Street and right on Franklin Avenue back to town hall, May 29, Memorial Town Hall, 340 Franklin Ave. wyckoff-nj.com, 201-891-7000, ext. 1180, dcapparelli@wyckoff-nj.com.

Burlington County

BURLINGTON CITY

Memorial Day Parade, march from city hall to Lambert-Sculley-Bozarth VFW, 9 a.m. May 29, Burlington City, High and Union streets. burlingtonnj.us, 609-386-0200.

EVESHAM

Memorial Day Ceremony, 10 a.m. May 29, Evesham Township Municipal Complex, 984 Tuckerton Road in Marlton. evesham-nj.org, 856-983-2900.

LUMBERTON

Memorial Day Parade and Service, march begins at 1 p.m., May 29, at Bella Road and concludes at Village Green Park for a wreath service. 609-267-3217, lumbertontwp.com. 609-267-3217.

MEDFORD

Memorial Day Observance, in partnership with Medford VFW Post #7677, 11 a.m. parade from Milton H. Allen Elementary School down South Main Street with stop at war memorial at Medford Memorial Community Center for flag raising, wreath laying and 21-salute, then marching north on Union Street to Freedom Park, for a ceremony May 29. bportocalis@medfordtownship.com, 609-654-2608, ext. 324.

MOORESTOWN

Memorial Day Ceremony, at Memorial Field Park, 254 S. Church St., 10 a.m. May 29, moorestown.nj.us, 856-914-3093.

MOUNT LAUREL

Memorial Day Tribute, wreath laying at Veterans Memorial, 6 p.m. May 25, Laurel Acres Park, 1045 S. Church St. mountlaurel.com, 856-727-0595.

RIVERSIDE

Memorial Day Parade, in partnership with the Sons of the American Legion, march from Bridgeboro Street to Riverside Municipal Court, 1 West Scott St., for a ceremony, 9 a.m. May 29. riversidetwp.org, 856-461-1460.

TABERNACLE

Memorial Day Parade, march from Seneca to town hall for wreath-laying ceremony, 9:15 a.m. May 27, Tabernacle Town Hall, 163 Carranza Road. townshipoftabernacle-nj.gov, 609-268-1220.

WILLINGBORO

Memorial Day Observance, 1 p.m. May 29, Foster Military Lodge, 351 Charleston Road. willingboronj.gov, 609-877-2200, ext. 1022.

Camden County

BARRINGTON

Memorial Day Service, 9 a.m. May 29, Barrington Fire Department, Second and Haines avenues. barringtonboro.com, 856-547-0706.

BROOKLAWN

Memorial Day Service, conducted by Brooklawn Memorial American Legion Post 72, 10 a.m. May 29, Brooklawn Memorial Park, South Hannevig and Maude avenues. 856-456-0750.

CHERRY HILL

Memorial Day Service, ceremony at War Memorial cohosted by American Legion Post 372 and Jewish War Veterans Post 126, 10 a.m. May 29, 820 Mercer Street. Events@chnj.gov, 856-488-7868.

GLOUCESTER CITY

Memorial Day Service, ceremony at the Veterans Monument at Broadway and Monmouth streets. 11 a.m. May 29, cityofgloucester.org, 856-456-0205.

GLOUCESTER TWP.

Memorial Day Observance, briefs visits to American Legion Post 281, Glendora VFW Post 8714, 9th Avenue monument in Glendora, Blackwood V.F.W. 7927, Harwan Park Monument, Gloucester Township School, Gloucester Township Community Park, Erial Cemetery, concluding with 11 a.m. service at Lt. Colonel Sam Siler Veterans Park, 1261 Chews Landing Road in Clementon, 8 a.m. May 29. glotwp.com, 856-435-5734.

HADDON HEIGHTS

Memorial Day Observance, wreath laying and dedication ceremonies at Sons of Italy, 6 W. Atlantic Ave., followed by parade down Station Road to Cannons War Memorial, 625 Station Ave. 10 a.m. May 29. 856-547-7164, tegbert@haddonhts.com.

LINDENWOLD

Memorial Day Tribute, 9 a.m. May 29, Lindenwold Park, 1000 United States Ave. lindenwoldnj.gov, 856-783-2121.

RUNNEMEDE

Memorial Day Service, 12 p.m. May 29, Veteran’s Green, Harry Williams Memorial, runnemedenj.org, runnemedeborough@gmail.com.

VOORHEES

Kirkwood Memorial Day Parade and Service, march from old Carriage House Restaurant, 1219 Kirkwood-Gibbsboro Road, right on Walnut Avenue, left on Second Avenue, right on Chestnut Avenue, then right on Burnt Mill Road, ending at Kirkwood Fire Station Veterans Memorial with wreath ceremony and service, 11 a.m. May 29, Voorhees Township Fire Department, 2002 S. Burnt Mill Road. voorheesnj.com, 856-429-7174.

WINSLOW

Memorial Day Service, ceremony with light refreshments at the War Memorial, 10 a.m. May 29, Winslow Municipal Building, 125 S. Route 73 in Braddock. winslowtownship.com, 609-567-0700.

Cape May County

AVALON

Memorial Day Parade and Ceremony, march from 32nd Street and Dune Drive to Veterans Plaza, 21 Street and Dune Drive, in coordination with American Legion Post 331, 9 a.m. May 29. avalonboro.net, 609-967-3066.

CAPE MAY

Memorial Day Ceremony, 11 a.m. remembrance in conjunction with the American Legion Post 193 and VFW Post 386 followed by U.S. Coast Guard Training Center Cape May detachments’ rifle salute and launching of flower boat from Gurney Street Beach, May 29, Soldiers and Sailors Park, Gurney Street and Columbia Avenue. capemaycity.com, 609-884-9525.

NORTH WILDWOOD

Memorial Day Ceremonies, 9:30 a.m. service at Hereford Inlet Lighthouse and 10 a.m. observance at Veterans Monument at Spruce and New York avenues hosted by VFW Post 5941, May 29, City of North Wildwood, 19th Avenue. northwildwood.com, 609-729-5832.

WILDWOOD

Memorial Day Ceremony, service on front lawn, 11 a.m. May 29, American Legion Post 184, 4200 Atlantic Ave. legion184.org, 609.522.3613.

Essex County

CALDWELL

West Essex Memorial Day Parade, march along Bloomfield Avenue concluding with ceremony at Crane Park, 9:30 a.m. May 29. westcaldwell.com, 973-226-3621.

EAST ORANGE

Memorial Day Ceremony and Parade, 9 a.m. ceremony at East Orange City Hall, 44 City Hall Plaza, followed by 11 a.m. parade beginning at the corner of South Arlington and Central avenues, May 29. eastorange-nj.gov, 973-414-4141

ESSEX FELLS

Memorial Day Ceremony, 8:30 a.m. May 29, Borough Hall, 255 Roseland Ave. essexfellsboro.com, 973-226-3400.

GLEN RIDGE

Memorial Day Parade and Service, march beginning at Sherman Avenue and Baldwin Street and proceeding to memorial in front of Ridgewood Avenue School, 235 Ridgewood Ave., for memorial ceremony, 11 a.m. May 29. glenridgenj.org, 973-748-8400.

LIVINGSTON

Memorial Day Observance, 9:30 a.m. remembrance ceremony at Memorial Park Oval, Robert Harp Drive, followed by parade, May 29. livingstonnj.org, 973-992-5000.

MAPLEWOOD

Memorial Day Parade and Ceremony, march from West Parker Avenue (student parking lot) to Maplewood Town Hall, for a ceremony, 574 Valley St., 9 a.m. May 29. maplewoodnj.gov, twpclerk@twp.maplewood.nj.us, 973-762-8120.

MILLBURN

Memorial Day Parade, march from Millburn High School, 462 Millburn Ave., to Taylor Park presented by American Legion Post 140, 11 a.m. May 29. millburn.org, administrator@millburntwp.org, 973-564-7000.

NUTLEY

102nd Annual Memorial Day Parade, march from Chestnut Street to Passaic Avenue, Centre Street and Franklin Avenue, 11 a.m. May 29, Nutley Park Oval, Franklin Avenue and Chesnut Street. nutleynj.org, johnsimko1014@gmail.com, 973-752-8984.

SOUTH ORANGE

Memorial Day Observance, ceremony at the duck pond, 9:30 a.m. May 29, Meadowland Park, North Ridgewood Road and Mead Street. southorange.org, 973-378-7754.

VERONA

Memorial Day Parade, march followed by ceremony at town hall, 10 a.m. May 29, Verona Civic Center Square, 600 Bloomfield Ave. kgould@veronanj.org, 973-857-4767.

WEST ORANGE

Memorial Day Ceremony, observance in front of the township municipal building, 66 Main St., 10 a.m., May 29, co-hosted by VFW Post 376 and the WOHS Air Force Junior ROTC Mountaineer Squadron. westorange.org, 973-325-4100.

Gloucester County

CLAYTON

Memorial Day Parade, march from ACME, 20 S. Delsea Drive, refreshments after parade at Clayton Elks Lodge No. 2132, Broad and Walnut streets. claytonnj.com, 856-881-2882.

DEPTFORD

Memorial Day Parade and Barbecue, march with bike-decorating contest starting from Princeton Boulevard to University Boulevard and College Boulevard to Veterans Park at Oak Valley School, concluding with memorial service followed by free barbecue, 10:15 a.m. May 29, Oak Valley Fire Company, 595 Princeton Ave. deptford-nj.org, 856-845-5300.

Jericho Memorial Day Observance, 11 a.m. May 29 Odd Fellows Cemetery, Church Street. deptford-nj.org, 856-845-5300.

GLASSBORO

Memorial Day Parade, march from Lehigh Road and University Boulevard to Whitney Avenue and High Street, ending at Glassboro Fire Department, with solemn ceremony at Veterans Memorial Plaza, 10 a.m. May 29, Glassboro Town Square, North Main Street and Rowan Boulevard. glassboro.org, tbryant@glassboro.org, 856-881-9230, ext. 88322.

MANTUA

Memorial Day Service, 10:30 a.m. May 29, Mantua Township Municipal Building, 401 Main St. mantuatownship.com, 856-468-1500.

SWEDESBORO

Memorial Day Ceremony, service at War Memorial at Borough Hall, 1500 Kings Highway, with guest speakers, community choir, Boy Scout Troop 13, VFW Post 10886, sponsored by the Greater Swedesboro Business Association, 10:30 a.m. May 29. historicswedesboro.com, 856-467-0756 or 856-498-9435.

WENONAH

Memorial Day Parade, march from Mantua and Marion avenues, to Wenonah Cemetery, 390 Wenonah Ave., for ceremony led by American Legion Post 192, 8:45 a.m. May 29. boroughofwenonah.com, 856-468-5228.

WEST DEPTFORD

Memorial Day Parade and Service, march from Colonial Ave. to Hessian Ave., ending at Red Bank Battlefield, 100 Hessian Ave., for a solemn ceremony. 10 a.m. May 29. westdeptford.com, 856-845-4004.

Hudson County

BAYONNE

Memorial Day Service and Parade, ceremony at Fifth Street by the WWI monument, then march from Fifth Street and proceed up Broadway, passing by American Legion Post 19, ending at 32nd Street and Broadway. 10 a.m. May 29, Donohue Park, Dodge and E. Fifth Street. bayonnenj.org, 201-858-6010.

EAST NEWARK

Memorial Day Observance, wreath laying ceremony, 6:30 p.m. May 26, East Newark Municipal Building, 34 Sherman Ave. boroughofeastnewark.com, 973-481-2902, ext. 221

GUTTENBERG

Memorial Day Observance, 11 a.m. May 30, Monument Park, 70th St and Blvd East. guttenbergnj.org, (201) 868-2315.

Hunterdon County

CALIFON

Memorial Day Parade and Kids’ Bicycle Parade, starting 11 a.m. on School Street, ending at Califon Island Park on Bank Street, north of Mill Street, for memorial service, music, antique cars, food and drink, 11 a.m. May 29. califonboro.org, bthomas@califonboro.net, 908-832-7850.

FLEMINGTON

Memorial Day Parade, march from Church Street near Rt. 31, travel west on Church Street and north on Main Street, sponsored by VFW 7586, 10 a.m. May 29. historicflemington.com, 908-782-8840.

GLEN GARDNER

Memorial Day Observance, ceremony with gun salute and taps followed by light refreshments, 10 a.m. May 29, Spruce Run Memorial VFW Hall, 179 Main St. vfwpost5119.com, 908-537-4525.

READINGTON

Memorial Day Parade, march from Kings Shopping Plaza on Main Street to Readington Municipal Building, 509 Route 523 in Whitehouse Station. 10:30 a.m. May 29, readingtontwpnj.gov, 908-534-4051.

Mercer County

HAMILTON

Memorial Day Parade, march from Nottingham Way at Weston Avenue east, turning left on Coleman Road and ending at fire company parking lot, 10:30 a.m. May 29, Nottingham Fire House, Nottingham Way. 2023memorialdayparade@gmail.com.

Groveville-Yardville Memorial Day Parade, march turning left on South Broad Street, then left on Route 524/Yardville-Allentown Road to Route 156, then left on South Broad and right on Main Street to Church Street, 8:30 a.m. May 29. gymemparade@gmail.com.

HIGHTSTOWN

Memorial Day Parade, 9 a.m. May 29. More details to come. hightstownborough.com, 609-490-5100.

HOPEWELL

Memorial Day Parade and Bike Brigade, 1 p.m. May 28. More details to come. hopewellboro-nj.us, 609-466-2636.

LAWRENCE

Memorial Day Parade, march from Lawrence High School, 2525 Princeton Pike, along Princeton Pike to Darrah Lane, Birchwood Knoll to Berwyn Place, concluding with services at Veterans Park, 100 Oaklyn Terrace, 10 a.m. May 27. lawrencetwp.com/departments/recreation, 609-844-7065.

PENNINGTON

Memorial Day Concert, featuring Mike Tusay and Lofash, 5:00 p.m. May 28, Howe Commons, 65 S. Main Street. penningtonboro.org, 609-737-0276.

Memorial Day Parade, with 9 a.m. gun salute and 10:15 a.m. Bike Brigade Judging, march starting at 425 S. Main Street. 11:00 a.m. May 29. penningtonboro.org, 609-737-0276.

PRINCETON

Memorial Day Parade, march from Princeton Avenue and Nassau Street to Monument Hall, 1 Monument Drive, for short ceremony, 10 a.m. May 27, princetonnj.gov, 609-924-4141.

ROBBINSVILLE

Memorial Day Commemoration, 6 p.m. May 25, Robbinsville Community Park, Flag Section on Gordon Road, robbinsville-twp.org, 609-259-3600.

WEST WINDSOR

Memorial Day Parade and Ceremony, march from West Windsor-Plainsboro High School South, 345 Clarksville Road, down Clarksville Road to the West Windsor Municipal Building, 271 Clarksville Road, for ceremony conducted in coordination with American Legion Post 76, 11 a.m. May 29. ghuber@westwindsortwp.com, westwindsornj.org, 609-799-2400, ext. 213.

Middlesex County

CRANBURY

Memorial Day Parade, march from South Main Street and Cranbury Station Road along Main Street to Plainsboro Road, Maplewood Avenue, Park Place East and then south on Main Street to Cranbury Fire House and Memorial Park, hosted by Cranbury Lions Club, 1 p.m. May 29. cranburytownship.org, 609-395-0900.

DUNELLEN

Memorial Day Parade, march from American Legion Post 119 to Washington Memorial Park, 300 N Washington Ave., for ceremony, 10 a.m. May 29. amiller@dunellenborough.com, 732-968-3033, ext. 8.

EAST BRUNSWICK

Memorial Day Observance, ceremony with flag raising, wreath laying, mini patriotic concert, 1 p.m. May 28, Veterans Park, East Brunswick Municipal Complex, 1 Jean Walling Civic Center Drive. eastbrunswick.org, 732-390-6850.

EDISON

Memorial Day Parade, march from Plainfield Avenue and Division Street to Lindeneau Elementary School, Blossom Street, 12 p.m. May 27, edisonnj.org, 732-248-7310.

HIGHLAND PARK

Highland Park/New Brunswick Memorial Day Parade, begins in New Brunswick section of Raritan Avenue and proceeds to Doughboy Monument in Highland Park, between Woodbridge Ave. And Raritan Ave., 10:30 a.m. May 29, hpboro.com, 732-819-0052.

JAMESBURG

139th Memorial Day Parade, 10 a.m. May 29, Veterans Memorial Park, Triangle Point of East Railroad Avenue, Lincoln Avenue and Stockton Avenue. jamesburgborough.org, 732-521-2222, jamesburg@jamesburgborough.org.

METUCHEN

Memorial Day Parade, march from American Legion Hall on Wernick Place, down Main Street, onto New Street, to Plaza, followed by ceremony at Memorial Park, 10 a.m. May 29. metuchennj.org, 732-632-8540.

MIDDLESEX

Memorial Day Parade, 10 a.m. May 29, ceremony at Victor Crowell Park, off Route 28, followed by parade at 10:45 a.m., refreshments at American Legion Post 306, 707 Legion Place, after parade. middlesexboro-nj.gov, 732-356-7400, ext. 258, or recreation@middlesexboro-nj.gov.

NEW BRUNSWICK

Highland Park/New Brunswick Memorial Day Parade, begins in New Brunswick section of Raritan Avenue and proceeds to Doughboy Monument in Highland Park, between Woodbridge Ave. And Raritan Ave., 10:30 a.m. May 29, hpboro.com, 732-819-0052.

NORTH BRUNSWICK

Memorial Day Commemoration, 11 a.m. May 29, Veterans Park, Roosevelt Avenue. northbrunswicknj.gov, 732-247-0922, ext. 475.

OLD BRIDGE

Memorial Day Parade, 9 a.m. May 29, march begins at Laurence Harbor Parkway and Ely Avenue. oldbridge.com, 732-721-5600.

PERTH AMBOY

Memorial Day Ceremony, 11 a.m. May 29, Veterans War Memorial, Sadowski Parkway. perthamboynj.org, 732-826-0290.

SOUTH RIVER

Memorial Day Parade, march from Main Street and Hillside Avenue to Jackson Street, to Ferry Street, to Main Street to the War Memorial building, 1 p.m. May 29. southrivernj.org, 732-257-1999.

WOODBRIDGE

Memorial Day Celebration, hosted by American Legion Post 87, with food and drink for sale and live music featuring RPM and Ricky Bobby, 314 Berry Street, 2 p.m. May 27, twp.woodbridge.nj.us, 732-634-9705.

Monmouth County

ALLENTOWN

Allentown Lions Club’s Memorial Day Parade and Ceremony, march from North Main Street and Allen Drive, concluding with a memorial service at Newell Elementary School, 10:30 a.m. May 29. rhschmittjr@gmail.com, 609-364-0176.

COLTS NECK

Memorial Day Parade and Service, march from town hall, 1 Veterans Way, stopping at Memorial Park, Heyers Mill Road, for a ceremony, concluding at Firehouse #2, 50 Conover Road. 10:30 a.m. May 29. coltsneck.org, 732-462-5470.

FARMINGDALE

Howell/Farmingdale Memorial Day Services, 11 a.m. service hosted by Howell Township Memorial VFW Post 9691 at Soldier’s Field, 793 Lakewood Farmingdale Road, and 11:30 a.m. service hosted by Farmingdale American Legion Post 178 at Lutz Park, at Main Street and Asbury Avenue. May 29. twp.howell.nj.us, 732-938-4500.

FREEHOLD

Memorial Day Parade and Ceremony, 8:30 a.m. service at Elks Lodge #1454, 73 E. Main Street, followed by march from Brinkerhoff Avenue and Main Street, through the center of town, left on Broadway, then Murray Street to Schanck Street and right on Monument Street, ending at Monmouth County Courthouse, 9:45 a.m. May 29. freeholdmemorialdayparade.com, 732-294-2000.

HAZLET

Memorial Day Ceremony, outdoor service with wreath-laying in Memorial Garden next to Town Hall, with participation from Hazlet VFW Post 4303 and the Hazlet Police Honor Guard and Chaplain, 10 a.m. May 29, Veterans Park, 1776 Union Ave., hazlettwp.org, 732-264-1700.

HOLMDEL

Memorial Day Ceremony, rifle salute and performance by Holmdel High School band. 10:30 a.m. May 29, 4 Crawfords Corner Road. recreation@holmdeltownship.com, 732-946-2820 ext.1225.

Memorial Day Ceremony, hosted by the NJVVMF, remarks by Nick Asselta, NJVVMF board member and brother of Charles C. Asselta, who was killed in action on March 18, 1968, 11 a.m. May 29. njvvmf.org, 732-335-0033.
